snippet: The decline of white male union membership to 23 percent has many causes, including the near-wipeout of manufacturing in the city, labor experts say.
abstract: CUNY Graduate Center study reveals that fully 60 percent of all union members in New York City identify themselves as either black or Latino; women who do not identify themselves as black or Latino make up an additional 17 percent; white men account for less than one-fourth of city's union members.
lead_paragraph: The decline of white male union membership to 23 percent has many causes, including the near-wipeout of manufacturing in the city, labor experts say.

headline.main: New York City’s Unionized Workers Are Mostly Minorities, a Study Shows
headline.print_headline: City’s Unionized Workers Are Mostly Minorities, a Study Shows
